sentences: Vana-Rooma väeüksus oli kümnendik leegioni ja sisaldas 500–600 meest.
Kangelaste kuulsusrikas kohort marssis mööda tänavaid.
context: The word 'meest' has multiple meanings in Estonian. As the partitive singular of 'mees', it means 'man' or refers to 'men'. It can also be used as the elative singular of 'mesi' meaning 'from honey'. Additionally, from the dictionary definition, it relates to 'kohort' (cohort) - a military unit in ancient Rome consisting of 500-600 men. The word appears to have flexible usage depending on context.
